sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"影响"之意。
means: affect ：作主语通常是物而不是人，指一物对另一物产生的消极影响。
influence ：侧重在思想、性格、行为等方面所产生的潜移默化的影响，也可指自然力的影响。
impress ：强调影响既深刻又持久。

sentence.Network_en: A style consultant will demonstrate how to dress to impress.
sentence.Network_cn: 时尚顾问将示范如何穿着以给人留下深刻印象。

sentence.Network_en: The speaker tried hard to impress the audience but left them cold.
sentence.Network_cn: 讲演者试图感动听众,但他没有打动听众的心.

sentence.Network_en: The boys were vying with each other to impress her.
sentence.Network_cn: 小伙子们争着给她留下好印象.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'apply with pressure'): from Old French empresser, from em- 'in' + presser 'to press', influenced by Latin imprimere (see imprint). Sense 1 dates from the mid 18th cent

entry.def: If something impresses you, you feel great admiration for it.

example.ex: What impressed him most was their speed...
example.tran: 最令他佩服的是他们的速度。

example.ex: ...a group of students who were trying to impress their girlfriends...
example.tran: 一群竭力想让女友刮目相看的学生

entry.def: If you impress something on someone, you make them understand its importance or degree.

example.ex: I had always impressed upon the children that if they worked hard they would succeed in life...
example.tran: 我总让孩子们牢记努力工作就会成功。

example.ex: I've impressed upon them the need for more professionalism...
example.tran: 我已使他们深刻认识到提高专业素养的必要性。

entry.def: If something impresses itself on your mind, you notice and remember it.

example.ex: But this change has not yet impressed itself on the minds of the British public.
example.tran: 但这一变化还没有引起英国公众的注意。

entry.def: If someone or something impresses you as a particular thing, usually a good one, they gives you the impression of being that thing.

example.ex: Billy Sullivan had impressed me as a fine man.
example.tran: 比利·沙利文给我留下的印象是他是个很不错的人。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of coercing someone into government service
1. have an emotional or cognitive impact upon;

sentences.sentence: "This child impressed me as unusually mature"
"The young chess player impressed her audience"

means.word_mean: 3. produce or try to produce a vivid impression of;

sentences.sentence: "Mother tried to ingrain respect for our elders in us"

means.word_mean: 4. mark or stamp with or as if with pressure;

sentences.sentence: "To make a batik, you impress a design with wax"

means.word_mean: 6. take (someone) against his will for compulsory service, especially on board a ship;

sentences.sentence: "The men were shanghaied after being drugged"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可压缩的, 可压榨的
stems_affixes.word_buile: compress[v.压缩]+ible能……的→adj.可压缩的, 可压榨的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 沮丧的,抑郁的;不景气的,萧条的
stems_affixes.word_buile: depress[v.压制,压抑]+ed……的→adj.沮丧的,抑郁的;不景气的,萧条的
ex出+press挤压→把[思想]挤出来→表达

stems_affixes.value_cn: 给人深刻印象的,感人的
stems_affixes.word_buile: impress印象,引人注目+ive……的→adj.给人深刻印象的,感人的
press挤压+ing……的→adj.急迫的
compress[v.压缩]+ion表名词→n.压缩,压紧,浓缩
depress[v.压制,压抑]+ion表名词→n.消沉;不景气萧条期
ex出+press挤压→把[思想]挤出来→表达

stems_affixes.value_cn: 表达;表情;声调;腔调;榨出;措词;式;符号
stems_affixes.word_buile: express表达,表示+ion→n.表达;表情;声调;腔调;榨出;措词;式;符号
impress印象,引人注目+ion表名词→n.印象,感想;盖印,压痕
oppress[v.压迫,压制]+ion表名词→n.压迫

stems_affixes.value_cn: 压,压力,压迫,强制,紧迫,困苦,困难
stems_affixes.word_buile: press挤压+ure表名词→n.压,压力,压迫,强制,紧迫,困苦,困难
suppress[v.镇压,压制]+ion表名词→n.镇压,压制
press挤压→n.&n.&v.压, 按
com一起+press压→一起压→压缩
de向下+press压→向下压→压制→情绪低下
ex出+press挤压→把[思想]挤出来→表达
im进+press挤压→压进去→盖印→印入头脑→留下印象
op加强动作+press挤压→拼命压→压迫
re回+press挤压→压回去
sup下+press压→压下去

sentences.en: I was very impressed by[at, with] her performance.
sentences.cn: 她的表演给我留下了深刻的印象。

sentences.en: The design was impressed on the cloth.

jushi.english: I was very impressed by〔at, with〕 her performance.
